Pitchess Detention Center Notary

Mobile Notary at Pitchess Detention Center in Castaic

When someone at Pitchess Detention Center needs documents notarized, we travel to the Castaic jail facilities so inmates can sign powers of attorney, real estate paperwork, court documents, and other legal forms without waiting until release.

Located on a 2,620‑acre property in Castaic off Interstate 5. Appointments coordinated around each unit’s professional visiting rules and security procedures.

Call or Text (213) 933‑2507 Schedule Castaic Notary Appointment
Facility information

About Pitchess Detention Center in Castaic

Peter J. Pitchess Detention Center (also known as Wayside Jail) is the county’s largest and oldest operating jail complex, situated on a 2,620‑acre property in Castaic off Interstate 5. The complex houses over 8,000 inmates across multiple facilities.

  • Main address: 29320 The Old Road, Castaic, CA 91384
  • Inmate information (24‑hour): (213) 473‑6100
  • Operated by: Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department
  • Total capacity: Over 8,000 inmates across all facilities
  • Professional visiting hours: Daily 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM (varies by unit)
  • Parking: Dr. Elmer T. Jafee Visitor Center lot; shuttle bus to facilities

Facilities on the Pitchess property

  • North Facility (PDC North): 29320 The Old Road — maximum security, 1,648 beds; watch commander (661) 295‑8059
  • South Facility (PDC South): 29330 The Old Road — includes fire camp program; watch commander (661) 295‑8011
  • East Facility (PDC East): 29310 The Old Road — medium security, currently closed
  • North County Correctional Facility (NCCF): 29340 The Old Road — maximum security, 4,295 beds

Why inmates at Pitchess need notary services

  • Longer stays in custody — Many inmates housed at Pitchess are serving sentences or staying for longer periods, increasing the need to manage life and finances from inside.
  • Property and vehicle matters — Signing deeds, titles, and other documents so family members can sell or manage property and vehicles.
  • Family and financial decisions — Powers of attorney and authorizations so trusted relatives can handle banking, benefits, and children’s needs.
  • Court and legal filings — Declarations, affidavits, and other documents needed for active cases.

Documents we notarize at Pitchess

Common Documents for Castaic Jail Inmates

Powers of attorney & authorizations

  • General power of attorney
  • Limited or special power of attorney
  • Durable power of attorney for finances
  • Healthcare power of attorney / advance directive
  • DMV power of attorney for vehicle transfers
  • Bank and financial institution authorizations

Real estate documents

  • Grant deeds and quitclaim deeds
  • Refinancing and loan modification paperwork
  • Property sale and escrow documents
  • Lease agreements and rental authorizations

Court & legal documents

  • Declarations and affidavits
  • Divorce responses and stipulations
  • Child custody and visitation agreements
  • Probate and estate documents
  • Civil case filings and responses

Other documents

  • Vehicle title transfers
  • Business authorizations and resolutions
  • Insurance claims and benefit forms
  • Any document requiring a notarized signature
How it works

Scheduling a Notary Appointment at Pitchess

1. Contact us with the inmate’s information

Call or text with the inmate’s full legal name, booking number (if known), and a description of the documents that need to be notarized. Let us know if they are at Pitchess or North County Correctional Facility, if you already know.

2. We confirm the exact facility and procedures

The Castaic jail complex includes multiple facilities with different visiting procedures. We confirm where the inmate is actually housed and what the rules are for professional visits at that specific unit.

3. Prepare your documents

Have all documents ready and complete before the appointment — we cannot draft legal documents, only notarize signatures. If the inmate needs to review documents first, coordinate with their attorney or mail the documents to the facility in advance.

4. The notary appointment in Castaic

We travel to the Castaic facility, clear security at the visitor center, and meet with the inmate in the designated professional visiting area. The inmate confirms their identity, signs the documents in our presence, and we complete the notarization with the appropriate certificate.

5. Document delivery

After the appointment, we return the signed and notarized documents to you, your attorney, escrow company, or other designated recipient — by hand delivery in the LA area, courier, or mail depending on your timeline.

Call or Text (213) 933‑2507 Schedule Appointment

Tip: Because Castaic is approximately 40 miles from central Los Angeles, appointments at Pitchess require more travel time. Contact us as early as possible so we can secure a time that works with your deadline and the facility’s schedule.

Pricing

Pitchess Detention Center Notary Fees

Notary appointments at Pitchess and the nearby Castaic jail facilities involve longer travel times and coordination. Pricing reflects the distance from central Los Angeles and the time required on site.

  • Pitchess / Castaic appointments: Typically higher than downtown LA jail visits due to distance
  • Price includes travel to Castaic, coordination, wait time, and notarization
  • Additional signatures at the same appointment may be added for a reduced fee
  • Rush or specific‑time appointments may have additional fees based on availability

What is included

  • Travel from Los Angeles to Pitchess (29320 The Old Road, Castaic) and back
  • Coordination with the specific Castaic facility
  • Security screening and wait time
  • Notarization of documents (California notary fees per signature)
  • Return of documents to you or your designated recipient

Because each Castaic visit is more time‑intensive, we provide a custom quote based on your exact needs. Call or text with the details and we will outline pricing before anything is scheduled.

Common Questions

Pitchess Detention Center Notary FAQs

How do I know if someone is at Pitchess or North County?

You can search the LA County Sheriff’s Inmate Information Center online at app5.lasd.org/iic using the inmate’s name and date of birth. The system will list the current facility, which may be one of the Pitchess units or North County Correctional Facility.

Can you visit more than one Castaic facility on the same trip?

In some cases, yes. If you have documents for inmates housed at different Castaic facilities, let us know. We can discuss whether it is practical to coordinate multiple visits on the same day, subject to facility schedules.

Do Castaic facilities have different visiting rules than downtown LA jails?

Yes. Each facility has its own schedule and rules for professional visits. For example, PDC South may allow professional visits daily from 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM, while PDC North may allow visits Monday–Friday during certain hours. We confirm the current procedures for the specific unit before your appointment.

How far in advance should I schedule a Pitchess appointment?

Because of the travel time and coordination involved, we recommend contacting us at least a few days in advance when possible. For urgent matters, call or text as soon as you know you need the appointment and we will see what options are available.

What ID does the inmate need?

Castaic facilities maintain booking records with photos that can be used for identification purposes. If the inmate has a valid California ID, driver’s license, or passport on file, that can also be used. We confirm ID options before the appointment.

What if the inmate is moved back to downtown LA?

Inmates can be transferred between Castaic and downtown facilities. We recommend confirming the inmate’s location close to the appointment time. If they have been moved, we can usually reschedule for the new facility (downtown or Castaic) with an updated quote if travel distance changes.

Other Facilities

Not sure which jail? Call or text with the inmate’s name and we can help locate them and coordinate the appointment. For an overview of all jail notary services, visit our LA County Jail Notary hub page.
